description: From Middle English forhowien, from Old English forhogian (“to neglect, disregard, despise”), equivalent to for- +‎ how. Cognate with Old Saxon farhuggjan, Old High German farhuggan.

verbs.description: forhow (third-person singular simple present forhows, present participle forhowing, simple past and past participle forhowed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, UK dialectal, Scotland) To forsake; quit; abandon; desert.
(transitive, UK dialectal, Scotland) To cast off; scorn.
